comments:
Build: I-20050919-0800

1. Fresh workspace
2. Import "org.eclipse.ant.core" as binary

You will get an NPE while converting the manifest:

Error 2005-09-19 08:35:12.510 java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.osgi.framework.Version.compareTo(Version.java:328)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.PluginConverterImpl.writeManifest
(PluginConverterImpl.java:239)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.PDEPluginConverter.modifyBundleClasspathHeader
(PDEPluginConverter.java:119)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.extractJARdPl
ugin(PluginImportOperation.java:484)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.importAsBinar
y(PluginImportOperation.java:255)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.importPlugin
(PluginImportOperation.java:189)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportOperation.run
(PluginImportOperation.java:119)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run
(Workspace.java:1719)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run
(Workspace.java:1739)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportWizard$2.run
(PluginImportWizard.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:113)

A fix has been released to HEAD.  The NPE was introduced from the fix to bug 
109526.  If writeManifest is called without calling convertManifest then 
target == null.  This has always been true but before it did not cause an NPE.

There is no reason to check the target value at writeManifest time because we 
just write all the headers out anyway.  The fix is to not check the target and 
write all the manifest headers that exist to the file.

I assume you would like this for M2?
Tagged fix for next M2 build.
